runs.comm: Badree gets this one to just turn away outside off as Guptill plays the wrong line
able to get him away by easing this next offering down to mid-off
on the pads as Ryder flicks this to midwicket for a single
heading down the leg side as Guptill plays this towards square leg
pushes this next one down to long-on for an easy single
worked away down to long-on to bring an end to the over
back of a length and going down the pads as Guptill plays this straight to silly mid-on
back of a length and nipping in as Guptill ends up getting a leading edge to the off side, and goes for the single
length outside off which is cut away in front of square to deep extra-cover. Poor running from these two as they are kept to just a single. Guptill assumed this was going all the way to the boundary

too full and straight as Guptill lofts straight down the ground, with a high finish, as Guptill keeps his steely eyes at the bowler, not once looking up to admire the shot. Hits this so cleanly at that
short and wide and Guptill cuts this away classically through point for a sublime boundary
just stand and deliver as Guptill is in the mood early on, thwacking this length ball straight back towards long-off for a boundary
length just outside off which is hit over to deep extra-cover, with the fielders making good work of it
down the leg side as the umpire signals a wide
steered away down to mid-on for a single
back of a length and pushed towards the fielder at mid-off
tries to get this round the corner past backward square, but the fielder comes immediately into play
pushed off the pads down to deep midwicket, running hard for the single
too much width on offer as Ryder is given the opportunity to free his arms and cut this away in front of square to the boundary
gets this one to just jag in from a length as Guptill plays loosely down the wrong line
just smashes through the line as mid-off is way too wide to get even close to this. What did Gups have for breakfast I wonder?
gets on top of this one to play it to the off side for a single
full and just outside off which is crunched down to sweeper cover for a single

and that proves to be a rather tame way to go out as Guptill slaps this back of a length delivery straight to short cover, who will not make a mess of it as Johnson Charles holds on to the chance. West Indies finally get one, as the run rate threatened to get away from them early on
length going down the leg side as Brendon is off the mark straightaway with a single to the off side
turns this fuller length ball going down the leg side for a single
advances down the track to this pitched up delivery, but Ryder ends up smashing this straight at McCullum's groin area. Had no place to escape to there
played off the pads to the leg side
fuller one which is defended back to the bowler
once again defended back to the bowler
back of a length outside off which McCullum charges at to find a gap through the off side, and more importantly, the boundary
he's not about to show any respect as he gets down on one knee to lift Narine over extra-cover for a one-bounce boundary
quicker one which he tries to play down to third man, but misses
on the back foot as he plays this with soft hands to the leg side for one
tries to turn this away to the off side, but fails to get a meaningful connection
this time pushed off the back foot to the leg side for one
a little bit of length as Ryder is able to get under this and paddle fine to the fine leg boundary
ends up driving this fuller one straight back to the bowler
McCullum looking to use his feet early on as this is pushed back to the bowler
a little room afforded outside off as he cuts this in front of square for one

full from Miller as Ryder hits this too well straight down the throat of long-on, who takes his second catch of the day. This is all met by silence from the crowd, as Ryder trudges off, probably ruing his most recent shot selection
reaches out to drive this down to sweeper cover
prods forward to play this with soft hands to the off side
low full toss which is driven down to mid-off
tries to squirt this length ball spinning in behind square on the off side
this time is able to carve this through the gap at cover for a single
this one stays a bit low as McCullum looks for his favoured short-arm pull
tries to eke this one out before square, but backward point is equal to the task
steps out to meet this one as a single is allowed through the off side by the West Indies
length which is driven down to the leg side for one
looks to get this one away to the leg side, but the bowler is quick on it
driven straight back to the bowler by Taylor
looks for two with a flick to the leg side, and is able to make it back in time before the throw is fired in at the striker's end
this time gets it down to deep fine leg for one
length ball on middle which gets a leading edge as this bobbles straight to Bravo at short cover, who won't make a hash of this one. New Zealand now three down
slower ball which is played away behind square on the off side

length going down tht eleg side as Brendon is able to ease this down to silly mid-on. Sets off for a quick single as Miller picks up and fires in a throw at the non-striker's, but it looks like Brendon just made it home
solidly played down the ground to long-off for a single
length outside off which is steered square into the vacant gap in the covers
pushed to the off side by Munro for a single
good change of pace as McCullum is coaxed into defending this offering from Bravo
Munro switches to a right hander position and gets deep in his crease to whack this over midwicket for a boundary
plays this one back to the bowler

Munro grossly mishits this next one from Miller, but fortune goes with the brave as this one just gets over the rope from quite a height. Kept the fielder interested till almost the last moment. Simmons attempts a dive, but this one was definitely going over
once again opts for the switch hit as this time he hits it a bit more squarer
length ball which Munro just has a go at, getting this to lift comfortably over the rope for a huge six
pushed to midwicket for the easiest of singles to end the over
tries to get this one away behind square on the off side, but is sent back by the non-striker as Baz goes for the dive, and makes it in time before the keeper flicks the bails
able to whip this off the pads for a single to the leg side

goes for the knuckeball as this one misses everything, and I mean everything. This one just bounces over the stumps, past the keepers, all the way to the boundary behind. Called four wides by the umpire
darts in a quicker one on middle as Munro uses the switch hit to get this away to the off side (or is leg side). Called a no-ball by the umpire, but the pair are unable to go for the single
free hit full from Narine as Munro chooses to stay in his customary left-hander position to club this over square leg to the orange brigade, who fail to get a catch
this one played to the off side for a single
goes high over the infield as this one lands safely in the deep on the leg side before stuttering to a sto p
this one rushes onto Munro as he is forced into an early pull shot which goes straight up. Fletcher, the wicketkeeper, calls this one straightaway, and is able to hold on to the chance
shortish length which is punched off the back foot straight to backward point
fuller one which is driven straight back to the bowler
Anderson unfortunately will not make his mark today as he pulls this back of a length delivery straight to the man at deep square leg. Best is super pumped after that wicket
shortish length which is punched off the back foot to sweeper cover for a single. Ronchi on his way
slower ball just outside off which is driven straight to long-off
just runs this length ball down to short third man
change of pace from Bravo as Ronchi tries in vain to get this away through the off side
back of a length which is edged down to third man for a single
length on middle which is eased down to long-on for a brace
shortish length played to backward point as the fumble from the fielder affords NZ a run
bangs this one in to possibly the worst person to ever off such a delivery to. Baz sees this one quickly and clobbers him over the fine leg boundary for six
another short one which is cross-batted towards long-on
full this time from Russell as Ronchi just lofts him gracefully down the ground for a six
back of a length as Ronchi just clears the fielder at backward point to find the boundary
length outside off which is hit way into the air as everyone at the ground is urging this to get over the rope, and it does. Russell what are you bowling here?
short one which rises quite high as the batsman goes for a pull
almost squares up Ronchi as he fends this one away behind point on the off side
misreads the amount of spin as Ronchi once again fails to get it away
this time catches the outside edge with a knuckeball
able to sneak a quick single down to backward point as he plays this with soft hands
plays this off the back foot straight to long-off
on the back foot and played away to the off side for one
round the wicket, pitching outside leg, as this is driven to long-on
full and straight at Ronchi hits this straight to the fielder at long-on
makes room by shuffling to the off side before drilling this one towards the covers
bowls another slower ball which Ronchi plays all around of
content to shoulder arms to this next one
full toss on the pads which hits the front pad of the striker
gets on one knee to clear this over midwicket for a six
going down the leg side as they get a couple
deliberately plays this one just outside off to the third man boundary for four
full again as Ronchi is able to clear him towards square leg for a boundary
defended to the off side
able to carve this fuller one behind square on the off side for a boundary
fuller one on middle which is hit down to long-on
fuller one from Bravo and steered down to deep midwicket
full again as Ronchi hits this one straight down to long-on
low full toss on the pads as McCullum plays a manufactured flick which just bounces before the fine leg boundary
full and on middle as McCullum spoons this one over the bowler to the fielder at silly mid-off
drives this one straight to long-off for a single
length ball on and around off which Ronchi fails to get bat on. So far so good...
length just outside off as Ronchi slaps him down to long-off for a single
swing and a miss from B-Mac as he completely misses the line
McCullum dances down the track and slams Best over the midwicket boundary to bring up his 50 off a heart-stopping 43 balls
low full toss as Brendon pulls out the straight paddle and then helps it along for it to go over the boundary for six. Tino has some choice words for BMac
another big swing and a miss as McCullum and Ronchi look for an opportunity for an extra run
